en.label: Renascence/Delayse Calendar
en.description: The calendar system used on Easolodia, featuring ten months that follow the eternal cycle of nature seasons.

months.name: Arkta
months.description: Named after the white dragon from Frozen Peaks. The deepest winter month when shadows reign supreme and the boundary between worlds grows thin and treacherous.

months.name: Freya
months.description: Named after the Goddess of Winter, the White Moon. The heart of winter's grip, when cold holds the land in its icy fist and survival becomes the only concern.

months.name: Mara
months.description: Named after the deer species, awakening from their slumber in this month. Winter's grip begins to loosen as ice melts and the first hints of spring stir beneath the warming earth.

months.name: Eos
months.description: Named after the Goddess of Spring, the Green Moon. The time of planting and new beginnings, when seeds are placed in fertile soil with hope for future abundance.

months.name: Arbre
months.description: Named after the Goddess of Nature, the Mother of Season. Spring reaches its crescendo as flowers burst forth and the world awakens in vibrant, living color.

months.name: Gaia
months.description: Named after the world's ancient name. Early summer brings lush growth and verdant beauty as nature displays its full, fertile power.

months.name: Lyn
months.description: Named after the Goddess of Summer, the Welcoming Sun. The peak of summer's heat and abundance, when the sun blazes strongest and crops ripen under its burning gaze.

months.name: Yar
months.description: Named after the red dragon from northern deserts. As summer's embrace weakens, folks celebrate the nature's warmth and prepare for the coming hardships.

months.name: Wei
months.description: Named after the Goddess of Autumn, the Orange Moon. The time of reaping and gathering, when communities work together to bring in the year's bounty before winter's approach.

months.name: Shai
months.description: Named after the sacred beast of harvest from Wutai Shan. Autumn storms wash the land clean as the skies weep for the dying year and the approaching darkness.

weekdays.name: Moonday
weekdays.description: Named after the moon, a day for reflection, planning, and quiet contemplation

weekdays.name: Toilday
weekdays.description: A day for hard work, labor, and productive endeavors

weekdays.name: Wealday
weekdays.description: A day for prosperity, trade, and community prosperity

weekdays.name: Oathday
weekdays.description: A day for keeping promises, honoring commitments, and sacred vows

weekdays.name: Fireday
weekdays.description: A day of passion, energy, and vigorous activity

weekdays.name: Starday
weekdays.description: A day for learning, magic, and studying the celestial patterns

weekdays.name: Sunday
weekdays.description: A day of rest, worship, and renewal under the sun's blessing

en.description: The large cold moon, seen on Winter and Summer.
The small bright green moon, visible on Spring and Summer
The little reddish moon, only appearing on Autumn and Summer.
